intro: Hypoxis atlantica, commonly known as the Atlantic yellowstar, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Hemerocallidaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is typically found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate saline conditions. Hypoxis atlantica is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance.
